head.title: Mercer Is Wooed, New Jersey Style

identified-content.classifier: Top/News/Sports/Pro Basketball/National Basketball Association/New Jersey Nets

hedline.hl1: Mercer Is Wooed, New Jersey Style

abstract.p: New Jersey Nets meet with free-agent shooting guard Ron Mercer, but will not make offer until they know if money will be available to augment salary cap (S)

block.p: The Nets met with the free-agent shooting guard Ron Mercer yesterday at the Champion Center in East Rutherford, N.J., promoting the team's training complex and its plans for a new up-tempo, defensive-style game under the rookie coach Byron Scott, and then entertaining Mercer regally for dinner.
''From our standpoint, yes, it went well,'' the Nets' president, Rod Thorn, said. ''But obviously Ron is being wooed by more teams than just us. He was in on a fact-finding mission.''

The Nets met with the free-agent shooting guard Ron Mercer yesterday at the Champion Center in East Rutherford, N.J., promoting the team's training complex and its plans for a new up-tempo, defensive-style game under the rookie coach Byron Scott, and then entertaining Mercer regally for dinner.
''From our standpoint, yes, it went well,'' the Nets' president, Rod Thorn, said. ''But obviously Ron is being wooed by more teams than just us. He was in on a fact-finding mission.''
The Chicago Bulls, the Miami Heat and the Boston Celtics are Mercer's other suitors in advance of the National Basketball Association's free-agent signing period, which begins Tuesday.

The Nets will not make an offer, however, until they know how much money, if any, will be made available to augment the salary cap. They are still awaiting a decision from the league regarding disabled-player exceptions for Jayson Williams and Kerry Kittles. Thorn said he expected the ruling Monday, and if the league grants one exception, it can free $3.8 million for negotiating with free agents like Mercer.
But Thorn did not discount the possibility of re-signing the veterans Kendall Gill and Johnny Newman. ''We're very interested in signing Kendall,'' Thorn said of Gill, the small forward.
